page.title: 15SOCIAL CONCERNS IN PENARTH
page.content: {Community concern}is evident in the use of land inside the boundary wall of now{demolished"Penarth House."In its place is"Sea Roads,"a fine example of{1930's style}architecture,with its flat roof and curved staircase.This was used as a{hospital for servicemen stationed in the town during WW2.In the same grounds are a{Private Nursing {Home,and Morel Court,a Methodist Home for the Aged.This has private bed_ sitting rooms with a communal lounge and dining{room.International House, built in 1964,meets the needs of men and women from overseas with differing customs and religions.There are 40 study bedrooms and central communal facilities,administered by the church. It is now being sold due to lack of funds.Proceeds will be used to help overseas students in the form of grants and chaplaincies.
